column1: We thought that she could not have done it all
column2: but that some careless person had left the chest open
column3: and the door unfastened. So Jenny was led back to her stall and tied up; the lid of the chest was shut down
column4: and the door closed and fastened with a hook.About an hour afterwards
column6: Madam Jenny was found as before
column7: with her nose deep in the meal-chest
column8: munching away with great relish. Then we knew she must have unhooked and opened the door
column10: as well as unhooked her halter.Do you not think she was pretty smart for a horse? Papa says it was more smart than honest to steal meal in that way. But I suppose horses do not know much about honesty.I liked Jenny all the better for her smartness
column11: and I have made a great pet of her since. As she is so fond of meal
column12: I take care to give her so much that she will not have to steal it.
